Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and offers views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall. Some reviewers mention the hotel being part of the Republican National Women's Club.
The 414 Hotel is near Times Square and Restaurant Row, offering clean, modern rooms. It is known for its quiet atmosphere, with some rooms overlooking a courtyard.

60 Thompson has a rooftop bar with great views, a hip lobby bar, and is located in the middle of SoHo, close to restaurants and nightlife. Some guests have reported noise issues and that the bars are closed for private events.

6 Columbus is a modern, boutique hotel located near Central Park and Columbus Circle, with a sushi restaurant and bar. Some rooms offer city views and balconies, while others are small and face airshafts, and some guests have noted noise issues from air conditioning units.
The rooms have very comfortable beds, down comforters and pillows, blackout shades, Candella nightlights, jacuzzi tubs, and iPod docking stations. Some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic.
The Ace Hotel has a hip, trendy vibe with a lively lobby scene, especially on weekend nights, and a bar. Some rooms feature unique amenities like guitars and record players.

The Affinia 50 offers spacious rooms, suites with balconies, and a club room with complimentary wine and cheese, providing a comfortable and social atmosphere. While some rooms can be noisy, the hotel's location is convenient to many attractions, and the hotel is close to a variety of bars and restaurants.

The Affinia Dumont offers spacious suites with comfortable beds, a full kitchen and high-floor rooms with great city views. It's located in a quiet residential neighborhood with many restaurants and bars nearby.
Affinia Gardens is known for its spacious, clean, and quiet rooms, offering a tranquil stay with comfortable beds and blackout shades. Some rooms feature kitchens and garden views.
Rooms at this hotel offer views, with higher floors possibly offering Empire State Building views. The hotel's bar is active at night and the hotel is close to Times Square.

The hotel boasts a rooftop bar with great views of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings, but it can be noisy due to the bar and nearby traffic. Quiet, comfortable rooms are available, especially those away from Lexington Avenue or internal-facing rooms, and balconies offer views of the Empire State Building and the New York skyline.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern apartments with full kitchens and comfortable bedrooms, located conveniently near Grand Central Terminus and the UN. Some rooms may experience noise from construction or traffic, while others face an office building, and the hotel has received mixed reviews regarding maintenance and service.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic hotel centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, with a cozy lobby and bar and there have been reports of noise from the road. Rooms are small, but clean and comfortable with quality bedding.

The Americana Inn is a budget-friendly, clean, and secure hotel in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square, but some rooms can be small and noisy due to street traffic. It has shared bathrooms, and a basic kitchen area on each floor, and is easily accessible to nearby shops and tourist attractions.

The Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway theaters, but many guests describe the rooms as small, dark, and sometimes noisy due to thin walls and street activity. The hotel has a bar and is undergoing renovations, but some amenities like the cappucino machine or advertised breakfast may not be available.

Astor on the Park is a budget-friendly hotel with small, clean rooms located in upper Manhattan across from Central Park. It's near the subway for easy access to the city center, though some found the location a bit far from major attractions and noted noise from old heating/plumbing systems.

The hotel is located in a quiet area within walking distance of many attractions, with rooms offering Empire State Building views. Some reviewers mention issues with noise from plumbing and thin walls, but others found the hotel quiet.
The Beekman Tower Hotel has a rooftop bar with great views. Some guests have found the rooms to be spacious, apartment-like suites.

The Belleclaire Hotel offers a range of rooms, from small rooms with shared bathrooms, to larger suites, but some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic or the building's radiator system; renovations have brought modern decor, comfortable beds, and amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docks to some rooms. Some guests have reported clean rooms with comfortable beds, while others have noted issues with noise, small bathrooms, and occasional maintenance problems.

The Bentley Hotel offers great views from the rooftop bar and some rooms, especially those facing the East River and Queensboro Bridge. The rooms are generally clean and comfortable, with some reviewers noting spaciousness and modern decor.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is located in Chinatown/Little Italy, close to subway stations for easy access to other parts of Manhattan. Some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic, particularly on lower floors.

The Best Western Convention Center is located in an industrial area near a 24-hour auto shop and train tracks, which some guests have found noisy. Some reviewers mention hookers nearby or protests outside, and others mention feeling unsafe in the neighborhood, especially at night.

The Best Western Hospitality House offers spacious apartment-style suites with full kitchens, making it comfortable for families or groups. It's centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to attractions like Times Square and Central Park, though street noise can be a concern.

The Best Western Seaport Inn is located in the South Street Seaport area and some rooms have views of the Brooklyn Bridge from a terrace or balcony. The hotel is in a quiet area near bars, restaurants, and cobblestone streets.

The Blue Moon Hotel, a renovated historic tenement building in the Lower East Side, offers uniquely decorated, spacious rooms with comfortable beds, and is lauded for its charm, cleanliness, and quiet atmosphere. Some rooms feature balconies with city views, and the hotel is located near various restaurants and subway lines, making it a good base for exploring New York City.

The rooms are generally quiet, with some offering views of the Empire State Building, and are accessible via elevators; however, the surrounding area is known to be deserted and unsafe at night. Some guests have reported rodent issues and noise disturbances.

The Buckingham Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchens, but some rooms are noisy due to the location on 57th Street and 6th Avenue and can be dated. Rooms feature CD players and sound systems, but some guests have reported uncomfortable beds.

Candlewood Suites Times Square is a new hotel located a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square with clean, well-equipped rooms that include a full kitchen, comfortable beds, and a flat-screen TV. Some reviewers mention the neighborhood may not be the most attractive and can feel unsafe at night.

The Carlton Arms is an artsy, budget-friendly hotel where each room is uniquely decorated by different artists, offering a memorable and adventurous stay. Some rooms have interesting or scary themes, and guests can choose their preferred room upon arrival.

The Carvi Hotel is a small, recently renovated boutique hotel with clean, modern rooms featuring marble bathrooms and comfortable beds. Some rooms may have undesirable views of adjacent buildings and potential noise from building air conditioning units.

Rooms at the Casablanca Hotel are very quiet, despite being steps away from Times Square, though some rooms facing the street may experience noise. The hotel offers complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings in Ricks Cafe, which is open 24 hours.

Chambers Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel known for its location near Fifth Avenue shopping and Central Park. Some reviewers highlight the unique, industrial-chic design, art pieces, and the powerful, wide shower head with Bumble & Bumble bath products.

Chelsea Lodge is located in a charming, safe, and quiet neighborhood, making it a great base for exploring NYC with many restaurants and bars nearby; some rooms may be small and have shared bathrooms. Some reviewers note the area is known for its gay scene.

Chelsea Pines Inn is located near many shops, restaurants, bars, clubs, and nightlife venues in Chelsea, Greenwich Village, and the Meatpacking District. It has comfortable rooms and subway access to all of NYC.

The Chelsea Savoy is located near subway lines and various establishments, with some rooms being quiet and of decent size for NYC standards. Some rooms have refrigerators, and complimentary pastries and coffee are offered in the morning.

City Club Hotel is known for its stylish, modern, and masculine decor, with some rooms featuring amenities like TVs hidden behind mirrors and DVD players. The hotel's location is central, close to Times Square and theaters, although some rooms can be small and dark with limited closet space.

The Solita Soho has a nightclub in the basement and is near many restaurants and clubs, but noise from the club and street may be an issue on lower floors. Some reviewers recommend requesting a higher floor to avoid the noise.

Club Quarters Downtown is in the Financial District, near Wall Street and subway lines, making it easy to get around Manhattan. Some reviewers note the area is quiet at night and on weekends, with limited dining options nearby.

Club Quarters Midtown is in an excellent location, close to Times Square and other attractions; however, some guests found the rooms small and the service impersonal. Some rooms can be noisy, and some guests have reported issues with the air conditioning or heating systems.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center is located in midtown Manhattan, near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall and 5th Avenue; some rooms have views of the Rockefeller ice skating rink and St. Patrick's Cathedral. The hotel has a terrace bar/restaurant on the 7th floor with views and a small fitness room.
The hotel is near Jay-Z's 40/40 club, and some rooms have views of the Empire State Building. Some reviewers mention noise from a nearby nightclub on weekends, while others found the hotel quiet.

The hotel is centrally located, close to the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square, with some rooms offering views; there are several bars and restaurants nearby, including an Irish bar across the street. Some reviewers mention noise from the street or a nearby building site.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is a new and clean hotel in Chinatown with comfortable beds and modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and free WiFi, with some rooms offering views of the Manhattan Bridge. Its location provides easy access to various neighborhoods and subway lines, with the possibility of experiencing the lively atmosphere of Chinatown.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is located near Times Square and Broadway, offering a convenient location for nightlife, though some rooms facing the street can be noisy, particularly in the early morning. The hotel is clean and includes free internet, a fitness center, and breakfast.

The hotel is located in the heart of the theater district near Times Square, with many restaurants and attractions nearby. Some rooms have views of skyscrapers and the hotel offers a free continental breakfast.

The hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square and other attractions, with rooms that are small but clean. Some rooms offer views of the city, and breakfast is included.
The hotel is next to a nightclub that is noisy until 4am and caters to a "certain lifestyle crowd". Some rooms have views of the New York Times building.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, design-focused hotel with comfortable beds, great views of the city from floor-to-ceiling windows, and a hip bar scene. Its location is convenient for exploring downtown New York, close to the East Village, Greenwich Village, and multiple subway lines.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is located in Tribeca, close to subway lines and downtown attractions, but some rooms facing the street can be noisy, requiring earplugs, though rear-facing rooms are quieter. There are restaurants and bars nearby, but the hotel itself is modest with small, clean rooms.
The Courtyard Times Square South offers a quiet and comfortable stay with comfortable beds, and blackout curtains. Rooms on upper floors may offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Courtyard Upper East Side is a clean, modern hotel with comfortable beds, a pool, hot tub, sauna, and steam room. Some rooms have East River views, and the hotel is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood close to museums, though a bit far from the subway.

The Courtyard Marriott on Fifth Avenue is centrally located near attractions like Times Square and the Empire State Building, but some rooms are small, and noise from elevators or neighboring rooms may be an issue. Some reviewers mention clean and modern rooms, while others cite cleanliness issues and small bathrooms.

The Courtyard Midtown East offers spacious, clean, and quiet rooms, some with great city views from upper floors and comfortable beds, and a location that is near a subway. A 24-hour pharmacy next door and free coffee on the 12th floor.

The Crosby Street Hotel in Soho is known for its charming and beautiful design, individually designed rooms, tall warehouse-style windows, impressive oak-tree floors, and a bar with over 400 bottles. The hotel also offers amenities like a drawing room for afternoon tea, spacious rooms, cozy beds, black-out curtains, and excellent water pressure in showers and tubs.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square offers rooms with views overlooking Times Square and the Hudson River, and concierge rooms with access to a lounge on the 46th floor, all in a location central to Broadway. The hotel provides amenities like comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and blackout curtains to enhance the guest experience.

The Da Vinci Hotel is in a great location near Columbus Circle and Central Park, with small, clean rooms. It has a restaurant and bar downstairs and is within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway.

Located in the heart of Times Square, the Doubletree Guest Suites offers spacious suites with cityscape views, blackout curtains, and soundproof windows. The hotel is near broadway shows, shopping, and public transportation.

The hotel is new, modern, and clean with comfortable beds, and offers rooms with views of the Empire State Building; however, rooms are small, and the surrounding neighborhood is not appealing. It is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and Chelsea, but the elevators are slow.

The Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel offers a bar and is located in close proximity to other bars such as Whiskey Blue and a lively atmosphere. It is also in a central location within walking distance of shops and various attractions.

The Dream Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel with a rooftop bar and nightclub. Rooms are often small, but some offer views of Broadway and Times Square, though noise from the street and club can be an issue.
The Duane Street Hotel is a small, modern hotel in Tribeca with comfortable beds and soundproofed rooms. Some rooms may be noisy due to street traffic or subway rumbling.

The Dylan Hotel is located near Grand Central Station and Times Square, but some guests have complained about noise, small rooms, and uncomfortable beds. Some rooms have views of office buildings or construction sites.

Eastgate Tower rooms are spacious and quiet, offer comfortable beds, and are located within walking distance of bars, pubs and other restaurants. Some reviewers noted good views from upper floors and a safe neighborhood for walking at night.

Econo Lodge Times Square is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway theaters, but many rooms are very small and some guests have reported noise issues. Some rooms include free bottled water and a small bag of chips.

The hotel offers manager's reception with free drinks every night, a bar, movie theater, and some rooms feature views overlooking the Hudson River. Some reviewers mention quiet rooms, a lack of noise and a peaceful night's sleep, while others mention thin walls and construction noise.

The Empire Hotel features a trendy rooftop bar with city views, a lobby bar, and sometimes live music, but the rooftop bar can get crowded, with long queues in the evening. Some guests have complained about noise from the rooftop nightclub, street noise, and noisy air conditioning units.

The Envoy Suites offers spacious apartments with fully equipped kitchens and a rooftop deck with skyline views, making it a comfortable choice for extended stays. Some rooms have comfortable beds while others have uncomfortable sofa beds, and the hotel is located within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building.

The Eurostars Wall Street is located in the Financial District, near Wall Street and South Street Seaport, and offers large rooms by NYC standards. Some rooms have two double beds, plasma TVs, and fully equipped kitchens, and the hotel is close to subway lines.

The Excelsior Hotel offers a good location on the Upper West Side, near Central Park and a subway stop, but some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic, and the heating/cooling systems may be difficult to control. While some rooms offer great views of the park and skyline, others face interior courtyards or brick walls.

The Fairfield Inn is a new hotel with clean, modern rooms, though they are small. It's located on a somewhat gritty street near the Port Authority, but is conveniently close to Times Square and the subway.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central has comfortable beds and quiet rooms, according to the reviews. Some rooms are luxurious with canopied beds, Italian marble bathrooms, soaking tubs with televisions, and rainforest showers.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is known for its comfortable beds, spacious suites, and a friendly Irish pub-style bar with a cozy atmosphere, making it a relaxing haven after exploring the city. Some rooms offer kitchenettes and multiple TVs, and the hotel's location provides easy access to shopping, Central Park, and subway lines.

The Flatotel boasts spacious rooms, some with jacuzzi tubs, and is centrally located near Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Center, offering easy access to city attractions. Some rooms have been renovated and some have not.

The hotel has a bar/restaurant that is open until 4 am and a night club at the ground floor, with some guests mentioning loud music in the lobby at night. Some rooms at the back of the hotel are subjected to loud voices from a bar at night.
The hotel is in a convenient location near SoHo and Greenwich Village, with easy access to subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and downtown Manhattan.

The Four Points Times Square is a new hotel with comfortable beds and a convenient location close to Times Square and subway lines. Some rooms have nice views, but the immediate area is described as gritty with adult shops and the Port Authority bus terminal nearby, which some guests found noisy.
The Four Seasons New York offers luxurious rooms with spacious bathrooms, soaking tubs that fill quickly, and high-end amenities. Some rooms offer city views, balconies, and high-floor locations.

Gild Hall has stylish, clean, and comfortable rooms, with luxurious linens and comfortable beds; it is located in the Financial District which is quiet at night but close to subway lines. Some rooms have frosted glass bathroom walls and doors that may not offer enough privacy.

The Gramercy Park Hotel features multiple bars including the Rose Bar (reservations required), Jade Bar, and a rooftop lounge/garden, offering different atmospheres, and often attracting celebrities. Note that the Rose Bar can be difficult to access even for hotel guests, and the rooftop may be closed for private events.

The Grand Hyatt is located in midtown Manhattan, next to Grand Central Station, with modernly decorated, spacious rooms, a bar, and limited food options. The walls are thin, and street noise can be heard; some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building.

The Greenwich Hotel offers uniquely decorated rooms with high-quality amenities, including Duxiana mattresses and Red Flower toiletries, with some rooms featuring courtyard views or balconies. Guests can enjoy a Japanese-style pool, spa, and complimentary snacks, with the option of dining at the hotel's Italian restaurant.

The Hampton Inn is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square, with subway access, clean rooms, and comfortable beds; some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building. The hotel provides free amenities like breakfast and Wi-Fi, but some reviewers noted small room sizes and elevator wait times.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden has comfortable beds and is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and other attractions. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast, free Wi-Fi, and has friendly staff.
The Hampton Inn Chelsea offers clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds, with some rooms offering city skyline views. The hotel is located in close proximity to many gay bars.

The Hampton Inn Soho offers rooms with city views, some of which include the Empire State Building, and a terrace on the 19th floor. The hotel is near SoHo shops, restaurants, and bars, and the West Village which has jazz and comedy clubs, and pubs.

The Hampton Inn Times Square South is a small, clean hotel in a convenient location near Times Square and Broadway. Some rooms offer city views, and the hotel provides free breakfast and internet access.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District offers clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds, and some rooms have balconies with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and the Seaport. Some reviewers mention quiet rooms, but others note noise from the street or lobby.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older, centrally located hotel with large rooms, some offering views of the Chrysler Building. Some reviewers mention romantic experiences and spacious suites with amenities like kitchenettes.

The Hilton Club is located in midtown, steps away from Rockefeller Center and minutes from Times Square, and offers suites on the 37th and 38th floors with a private check-in. Some rooms have been newly decorated and the hotel offers a gym, business center, complimentary breakfast, a cocktail reception, and comp passes to nearby gentlemen's clubs.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea has clean, comfortable rooms with comfortable beds, HD TVs, and free WiFi, and is centrally located near subway lines and attractions. Some reviewers mention high floors with city views, while others note the hotel is relatively quiet.

The Hilton Garden Inn on 35th Street is centrally located near the Empire State Building and Times Square, with subway access and a lively, safe neighborhood. Some rooms offer city views, and the hotel is new, clean, and has comfortable beds, HD TVs, and free WiFi.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is centrally located, with walking distance to broadway shows, Times Square and nightlife. There is also a rooftop bar and rooms feature comfortable, adjustable beds.

Rooms have comfortable, adjustable beds, microwaves, and mini-fridges, with options for rooms with jacuzzi tubs. There is a club across the street from the hotel that can have loud music until 4 AM on weekends.

The Hilton New York is in a great location, with many rooms offering views of Central Park, and is near entertainment like Broadway and Radio City Music Hall. Some rooms have been newly renovated with comfortable beds and a flat-screen TV.

The Hilton Times Square offers large, clean, and quiet rooms on high floors, providing great views of the city and the Empire State Building, with blackout curtains.
It is centrally located near Broadway theaters, Times Square, and subway lines.

The Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue offers a central location near Times Square and 5th Avenue, with clean, modern rooms, though some reviewers note they are small. There is a free breakfast, and some rooms have views of office buildings or the street.
The Holiday Inn Express Times Square is a new hotel with clean, comfortable rooms, though small as expected in NYC. It's located a short walk from Times Square and offers free breakfast and internet.
The hotel is located near a nightclub, which could cause noise until 5 AM; some rooms have whirlpool tubs and city views. Noise from slamming doors and thin walls may disrupt sleep.

Rooms are clean and comfortable; however, some guests have noted noise from the subway which runs underneath the hotel. The hotel is located in Chinatown, a short walk to many restaurants, shops, and tourist attractions, and the area is considered safe.

The hotel is in a great location near Central Park and Times Square with some rooms being spacious, though some guests have found them dated, noisy, and smelly. The rooftop pool is a plus, but it closes early.
The hotel is in a central location with nice views from higher floors, and is close to subway stations and attractions. The rooms are small, but clean and modern.

Hotel 17 is in a great location near Union Square, Gramercy Park, and the East Village, with many restaurants and bars nearby; some rooms are quiet, and some have views. Rooms are small and have shared bathrooms that are generally clean.
Hotel 31 is a budget hotel with small, clean rooms, and shared bathrooms, located near the Empire State Building. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building.

Hotel 373 is centrally located, near the Empire State Building, with small, clean, and modern rooms that include comfortable beds and iPod docks. Some rooms on higher floors offer views and quietness, although street noise can be a concern.

Hotel 41 is a small, clean, modern hotel that is steps from Times Square and features a popular bar that is open late; the hotel also offers free DVD rentals and Aveda bath products. Some rooms have terraces, and happy hour is offered in the bar with discounted drinks.

Hotel 99 was a new hotel in Upper West Side, close to the metro, with modern, clean, and well-equipped rooms including flat screen TVs; it was still under construction with discounted rates, but was closed by the fire department due to alarm issues in November 2009, leading to guest relocations.

The Beacon Hotel offers spacious rooms, some with king-size beds and comfortable bedding, and is located in a quiet neighborhood, away from the noise of Times Square, with subway access nearby. Some rooms have views of Central Park and the Hudson River.

Hotel Chandler is a clean, quiet, and comfortable boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan with Frette linens and Aveda toiletries, with a bar that offers happy hour specials. Some rooms have blackout blinds and turndown service, and the location allows for a good night's sleep away from the hustle and bustle.

Hotel Deauville is a budget-friendly option with clean, basic rooms and a helpful staff, located near the subway and within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building. Some rooms have purple bathrooms and views of brick walls, while others offer views of the Empire State Building.

The hotel has a rooftop terrace with city views and is located near many bars and restaurants. Some rooms have soundproof windows, and some have a glass wall separating the bathroom from the rest of the room.
The Hotel Elysee offers a comfortable stay with spacious rooms, a complimentary breakfast, and a wine and cheese hour on weekdays. The Monkey Bar is located next door.

Hotel Gansevoort is known for its lively atmosphere, rooftop bar, pool, and proximity to the Meatpacking District's nightlife, restaurants, and clubs. Be aware that the hotel can be noisy at night, especially on lower floors.

Hotel Giraffe offers a rooftop bar open until after midnight and has a nightclub in the basement, Barna, open until 4 AM on weekends. Some reviewers mention the hotel can be noisy due to construction and street traffic, so a room on a higher floor might be preferable.

The hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building and several subway lines, making it easy to access many parts of Manhattan. Rooms are basic, clean, and on the smaller side, with comfortable beds, air conditioning, and private bathrooms.

The Hotel Indigo - NYC offers spacious rooms with comfortable beds and Aveda toiletries, and is conveniently located near Times Square and multiple subway lines. Some rooms have king-sized beds and large flat-screen TVs, but lack amenities like coffee makers and luggage racks.

Hotel Mela is a chic, modern hotel near Times Square, with clean, though small, rooms and a great location near restaurants and Broadway; some rooms have nice bathrooms and comfortable beds, and the hotel is known for its friendly and helpful staff. However, the hotel rooms are known to be very small and can be noisy at times because of its location in the heart of the city, with some rooms having limited views.
The Hotel Metro has a rooftop bar with amazing Empire State Building views, though it may be closed depending on the season; some rooms on the front of the hotel can be noisy.

Hotel Newton is a budget-friendly option near the 96th Street subway station, an express stop that gets you to Times Square quickly, with some rooms featuring kitchenettes, microwaves, and refrigerators. The hotel's Upper West Side location offers a quieter, neighborhood feel with easy access to Central Park and various shops and restaurants.

The Hotel on Rivington offers comfortable rooms with incredible views, especially from higher floors, and is located in the lively Lower East Side known for its nightlife. However, street noise and club noise can be an issue, potentially disrupting sleep.

Hotel Reserve is located in the Financial District, close to subway lines, and offers clean, modern rooms, some with large LCD TVs. Some reviewers mention the hotel is quiet at night, while others note thin walls and potential noise from slamming doors or neighboring rooms.
The St. James Hotel is in an excellent location near Times Square with a lively atmosphere, delis, and Irish pubs; some rooms have street views and noise. The hotel is undergoing renovations.

The Hotel Stanford offers a central location in Midtown Manhattan, with some rooms providing views of the Empire State Building. Some reviews mention quiet upper floors, but others describe noise from the street or neighboring rooms, and some rooms have small windows or views of brick walls.

Hotel Wales is located on the Upper East Side, close to Central Park and museums; some rooms are small, and there is a rooftop terrace. The hotel has undergone renovations, with updated rooms and features like a complimentary breakfast and a 24-hour coffee/tea service.

The Hudson Hotel is a hip, trendy hotel with a lively bar scene, exposed brick, and trendy music that is popular with younger crowds. It has a nightclub open until at least 2 AM with access to a rooftop bar, library bar, and bars in the lobby, although some reviewers note noise from the bars can be heard in rooms below the 6th floor.

The Ink48 offers spacious rooms, some with city or Hudson River views, and large bathrooms; some suites have floor-to-ceiling windows. A rooftop lounge with a hot tub was in development at the time of these reviews.

The Inn New York City offers uniquely decorated suites with amenities like jacuzzis, saunas, fireplaces, and private terraces. Guests can expect a quiet, private experience with luxurious touches such as gourmet snacks, fresh pastries, and comfortable beds.

Rooms feature luxurious, comfortable beds, and some suites have kitchenettes; however, the walls may be thin, resulting in noise issues. The hotel is in a central midtown location, but close to lively tourist attractions such as Times Square.

The Essex House is in an excellent location across from Central Park and offers comfortable beds, soundproof rooms, and blackout curtains. Some rooms have floor lights and blackout signs controlled from a bedside touch panel.

The Kitano Hotel is in a good location near Grand Central Station, with spacious, clean, and quiet rooms that feature comfortable beds, soundproof windows, and Japanese-inspired amenities like green tea makers. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building or Chrysler Building, and the hotel has a jazz bar with live music on certain nights.

The hotel has a rooftop bar with views of the Empire State Building, and it is next to many Korean restaurants and karaoke bars. Some guests mention noise issues due to thin walls and the rooftop bar.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in the East Village offering large, uniquely decorated rooms with antique furniture, fireplaces, and sitting areas; some rooms have terraces or courtyard access. The hotel's location provides convenient access to nearby restaurants, bars, and various downtown neighborhoods.
Le Parker Meridien offers a rooftop pool and sundeck with amazing views of Central Park and the city, proximity to bars, and dark rooms. Some rooms have a VCR and DVD player, a TV, and soundproofing.

The Library Hotel offers a rooftop bar and garden with views, and some rooms have balconies; it's in a convenient midtown location close to dining and transportation. Some reviewers described it as a romantic getaway with chocolates and weather forecasts by the bed every night.
The Loews Regency is located on Park Avenue and offers traditionally decorated rooms with comfortable beds. Some rooms have kitchenettes, and suites are available.
The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side with suites that feature kitchens, fireplaces, and marble bathrooms with TVs. Some rooms have terraces and views overlooking The Pierre.

The Mandarin Oriental New York offers stunning views of Central Park and the Hudson River from its rooms, especially those on higher floors, and has a lobby bar with views. Some rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows, chaise lounges, and well-equipped bathrooms with soaking tubs and TVs.

The Milford Plaza is located in the heart of the Theater District and close to Times Square, and some reviewers found it safe and comfortable, while others mention rooms that were small, old, and noisy. The surrounding area has bars, restaurants, and theaters, but the hotel itself lacks a bar.

The Millenium Hilton offers rooms with great views, especially on higher floors, of the Hudson River, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the WTC site; the hotel has a modern style, a pool, and is near subway lines for easy access to other parts of the city, though the immediate area is quiet at night. Some reviewers noted noise from ongoing construction at the WTC site, which may affect the quality of sleep.

The Millennium Broadway is located right off Times Square, with many high floor rooms offering views of Times Square and other landmarks. The hotel offers various amenities including a gym, spacious rooms, and is located near several bars and restaurants.

The Millennium UN Plaza Hotel offers amazing views of Manhattan and the East River from its high-floor rooms, a heated indoor pool with panoramic views, and large rooms. It is located in a quiet area near the UN, with Grand Central Station a short walk away.
The Moderne Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, with some rooms offering a dark and quiet atmosphere. The hotel is near a pub and some rooms have brick wall views.

Morgans is a stylish, modern hotel with uniquely designed rooms, some offering views of the Empire State Building, and comfortable beds; it is located close to many attractions and transportation options. The hotel provides complimentary breakfast and a living room area for guests to relax.
Murray Hill East Suites is in a good location near Grand Central Station with spacious rooms, and some rooms have Empire State Building views. There are several restaurants and bars close by.
Murray Hill Inn is a budget-friendly, clean hotel in Midtown Manhattan, with small rooms and no elevator. Some rooms have private bathrooms and flat-screen TVs.

The hotel has spacious and clean rooms with comfortable beds and views of the Hudson River, Ellis Island, and the Statue of Liberty from higher floors. It also has a classy lobby, a small bar, and is close to multiple subway lines and other attractions.

The hotel has comfortable beds and corner rooms with great views and large windows; some rooms have whirlpool tubs and fireplaces. However, there are reports of street noise, dated rooms, thin walls, slow elevators, and noise from nearby construction at night.

The Marriott Marquis is located in the heart of Times Square, offering rooms with views of the city and Broadway; it has a revolving restaurant/bar on the top floor and a lobby bar with views of Times Square. It is near many Broadway theaters and has a show theater inside the building.

The hotel has rooms with views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and is centrally located near shopping, Central Park, and Times Square. The hotel has a bar, Gilt, that is decorated in gold leaf and chandeliers.

The Night Hotel is a trendy, gothic-themed boutique hotel near Times Square, known for its stylish black and white decor, plasma TVs, and Bose sound systems; the bar area sometimes hosts lively parties and events. Rooms are small, and some guests have noted noise from the bar or street, so it might not be the best choice for those seeking tranquility.

The Novotel Times Square offers rooms with views overlooking Times Square and Broadway, along with a bar/restaurant and sky terrace that provides great views of Times Square at night. The hotel is centrally located near Broadway shows, restaurants, and Times Square.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-like suites with kitchens at affordable prices in a location near multiple subway lines and within walking distance of Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho. Some rooms have windows that open, and some suites include a separate living area, while the surrounding area may have some noise from a nearby bar/restaurant.

The Fireside Restaurant and Bar at the hotel is a nice place for a late-night drink, and rooms are quiet, with some featuring jacuzzi tubs and turndown service that includes chocolates. Some rooms have views of the city, and rates are reasonable.

The hotel offers clean, modern rooms, some with balconies and views of the Hudson River or Central Park, and is located in a quiet, residential Upper West Side neighborhood close to subway stations and restaurants. A popular spot for adults, the hotel has a roof terrace on the 16th floor with city views.

Park 79 is a budget-friendly hotel located on the Upper West Side, with small, clean rooms and a location close to Central Park, museums, and subway lines; some rooms have shared bathrooms, and noise from hallways or neighboring rooms may be an issue. Some reviewers mention the hotel being quiet, but others mention noise.

The Park Central Hotel is in a great location, close to Central Park, Times Square, and near many shops and restaurants that are open at night, and the bar is open until midnight. However, some rooms may be noisy and/or dark.

The Black Duck restaurant and bar is attached to the hotel and features live jazz on Friday and Saturday nights; room 407 on the fourth floor has a super king-size bed, large plasma TV, and a clean, modern bathroom. Some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building.
The Peninsula New York offers spacious, well-decorated rooms, some with Fifth Avenue views, and large bathrooms with TVs. The hotel features a rooftop bar with city views, a pool, and a spa.

The Phillips Club offers stylish studios, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens for short or long-term stays, steps away from Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, and a subway station. Some suites offer impressive bathroom facilities and views, with proximity to Balducci's gourmet grocery store.

The Plaza Athenee is a smaller, intimate European-style hotel on the Upper East Side, known for its quiet atmosphere, attentive service, and residential feel. Some rooms offer great views, French furniture, and luxurious comfort, though some are small, dark, and face brick walls.

The Radisson Martinique on Broadway is in a great location near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Penn Station, and some rooms have a comfortable Sleep Number bed, but there can be thin walls and noise issues. The hotel's surroundings include Korean restaurants and karaoke.

Ramada Eastside offers clean and comfortable rooms with complimentary breakfast and free Wi-Fi, in a location that is conveniently located near the subway and within walking distance of the Empire State Building. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler Building, and the hotel is close to a variety of restaurants.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is in a central location close to the Empire State Building, with some rooms offering a view, and near 24-hour restaurants and bars. Some rooms include amenities like i-Pod docks and large TVs, but some guests have noted noise from nearby bars, thin walls, and slow elevators.

Hotel 57, now the Renaissance 57, is a boutique hotel with a convenient midtown location close to shopping, attractions, and subway lines; it features a restaurant/bar/lounge (Opia), and a new concierge lounge. Some rooms have terraces and city views, and may be small but have comfortable beds and modern design.

The Renaissance Times Square offers rooms with great views of Times Square, and is located in the heart of the Theater District. It has a restaurant with direct views of the ball drop, which can be reserved during New Year's.

The hotel offers spacious, clean rooms with comfortable beds, with upper floors providing spectacular views of the Empire State Building and the city, making for memorable nights. The hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and other attractions and is known for being quiet, ensuring a peaceful night's sleep.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park offers harbor view rooms with telescopes, and the Rise bar on the 14th floor with skyline views. Some rooms have whirlpools and rose-petal turndown service can be arranged.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is in a central location near many attractions, and some rooms have views of St. Patrick's Cathedral or Radio City Music Hall, with a restaurant/club on the 7th floor, and a heated outdoor deck. Some rooms feature comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and modern bathrooms, though some have frosted glass doors that offer limited privacy, and some rooms are very small.

The Roger Smith Hotel, located in midtown Manhattan, offers spacious rooms, uniquely decorated with comfortable beds, and is near Grand Central Station. It has a bar/restaurant called Lily's and an art gallery.

The Roger Williams Hotel offers comfortable beds, clean rooms, and a central location, with some rooms featuring terraces and views of the Empire State Building. The hotel is known for its quiet atmosphere at night, making it a potentially good choice for a restful stay.

This trendy, modern hotel has a 24-hour bar and pool, with parties and DJs on some nights; Some rooms can be noisy from the parties, so ask for a room on a high floor. Some reviewers mentioned meeting single women at the pool bar.
The Royalton is a trendy, stylish hotel with a popular bar scene, fireplaces in the lobby and some rooms, and large soaking tubs. The hotel's dim lighting creates a romantic and moody atmosphere.

The Salisbury Hotel has a convenient location near Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Times Square, but some rooms facing 57th Street can be noisy. Reviews mention some rooms having large flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds.

The San Carlos Hotel offers spacious and clean rooms, some with kitchenettes, and is located in a safe midtown location near many attractions. It has friendly staff, a free business center, and offers a complimentary continental breakfast.

Seafarers International House is a budget-friendly option located near Union Square, with rooms that are basic but clean, and some noise from the city streets. Some rooms have private bathrooms, while others share facilities, and there are several bars in close walking distance.

The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers offers a prime location near Times Square and Central Park. Some rooms offer views, but can be small, and there are reports of noise, though rooms on higher floors are generally quieter.

The Skyline Hotel offers clean and spacious rooms, some with views of the Empire State Building, and is within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway. The hotel also features an indoor rooftop pool, though the hours are limited, and a bar that some reviewers found "dark and dismall" while others found it a good place to relax.

The Smyth Tribeca is a modern, stylish hotel with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and large bathrooms, some featuring frosted glass walls and open showers. It is located in Tribeca, close to subway lines, restaurants, and shops.

The Sofitel New York offers luxurious and quiet rooms with comfortable beds, blackout curtains, and a turndown service with classical music and bottled water; some rooms on higher floors offer views of the Chrysler and Empire State buildings. The hotel also has a bar and is located close to theaters.

The Soho Grand is known for its trendy bar and lounge scene, which can be busy and noisy, and a New Year's Eve party, but some guests experienced noise issues affecting their sleep. The hotel's location in SoHo provides access to nightlife, shops and restaurants.

Soho House New York is a trendy, sometimes noisy hotel in the Meatpacking District with a rooftop pool and bar scene that is very busy, especially during summer. The hotel is known for its stylish decor, spacious rooms, and proximity to nightlife, although noise from the surrounding clubs can be an issue.

The Stay Hotel has a lively bar/nightclub (Aspen Social Club) in the lobby that is open until 4 AM on weekends, but noise may be an issue for some rooms. Some rooms have views of a brick wall, and the hotel is steps away from Times Square.

The Alex Hotel offers modern suites with comfortable beds, high-end toiletries, flat-screen TVs, and kitchenettes, with some rooms providing views of the Chrysler Building. Some reviewers mention quiet rooms, blackout shades, and convenient access to nearby bars and restaurants.

The Belvedere Hotel is in a central location near Times Square and Broadway, some rooms are spacious and have kitchenettes with microwaves and fridges. There are also many restaurants and bars in the area.

The Benjamin offers comfortable beds, a pillow menu, and soundproof rooms for a good night's sleep. Some rooms include amenities such as a white noise machine, turndown service, and sleep-related room service options.
The Blakely Hotel offers comfortable beds, spacious rooms, soundproofing, and blackout drapes. Some reviewers note noise from street traffic and garbage trucks, while others found it quiet.

The Bowery Hotel features comfortable beds, soaking tubs with city views, and a lively bar scene; some rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows offering great views, and the hotel is located near nightlife in the Lower East Side. Some reviewers noted the hotel can be noisy due to its location.

The Bryant Park Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel with a lively cellar bar and a popular Japanese restaurant, Koi, making it a hot spot for nightlife. Some rooms have balconies with city views and iPod docking stations for entertainment.

The Carlton on Madison offers clean, stylish rooms with comfortable beds, sometimes including views of the Empire State Building, and is centrally located near subway lines. Some rooms may be small and there may be noise from nearby clubs, however it has a stunning lobby.

The Carlyle is a classic, old-school luxury hotel with a classy atmosphere, a famed Cafe Carlyle with jazz shows, and the Bemelmans Bar with live music and Madeline drawings. The hotel is located in the Upper East Side, near Central Park and Madison Avenue boutiques.

The Franklin Hotel is located on the Upper East Side, near a subway station, Central Park, and museums. It offers small, clean rooms with comfortable beds, high-quality linens, and amenities like complimentary breakfast and evening wine and cheese.

The hotel is located near Times Square and Restaurant Row, with some rooms above a lively bar (Bourbon Street). Some guests have reported noise issues from the bar, while others found the rooms quiet and comfortable.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is a modern, clean hotel in Chelsea with small, European-style rooms, comfortable beds, and amenities like free Wi-Fi and iHome docking stations. The hotel is located near the subway, restaurants, and attractions, with friendly staff available to assist guests.

The hotel is located a 10-15 minute walk from Broadway and the Empire State Building, and near Penn Station, but some reviewers found the immediate area undesirable, especially at night. Rooms are small but clean, with comfortable beds and amenities like flatscreen TVs.

The Gem Hotel is located in a lively part of town near SoHo, Little Italy, and the Lower East Side, with many clubs, restaurants, and shops nearby. Some rooms may be noisy due to street traffic, but quiet rooms facing Forsythe Street are available.

The Grant Hotel is a budget-friendly option near the subway and Central Park, with clean but small rooms and shared bathrooms. Some rooms have been renovated, and some guests have reported issues with bedbugs and theft.

The Hampton Inn has clean and spacious rooms, great bed and blackout curtains, close to attractions, and open 24/7 making it safe, well-located, and easy to come and go at any hour. Some guests recommend booking rooms away from the street on higher floors to reduce noise levels, but others appreciate the city views and do not mind the sounds of the city.

The Helmsley Carlton House is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park. It offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes, and junior suites, some of which have balconies overlooking Central Park.

The Helmsley Park Lane is in an excellent location across from Central Park, with some rooms offering spectacular views of the park and city from high floors; some rooms are palatial and elegant, with features such as slippers, bathrobes, and turn-down service. The hotel has a bar and restaurant, but some reviewers note the hotel is outdated and may need renovation.

The Herald Square Hotel is centrally located with comfortable beds, some rooms have been newly renovated and feature flat-screen TVs. Rooms may be small and some guests have noted noise issues, but it is close to the Empire State Building and subways.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Chinatown, with some rooms facing the Manhattan Bridge and experiencing noise from trains, while others are quieter. The hotel offers clean rooms with comfortable beds, but lacks amenities such as a restaurant, and is located far from Midtown attractions.

The Hotel at Times Square is in a great location, within walking distance to Times Square and many attractions, and the rooms are clean and modern. Some rooms have iPod docks, flat-screen TVs, and comfortable beds.

The Inn at Irving Place is located in a pair of combined brownstones with uniquely decorated rooms furnished with antiques. Some rooms have fireplaces and sitting areas, and the hotel offers tea service in an opulent dining room.

The Iroquois Hotel offers comfortable rooms with high-quality linens, Molton Brown toiletries, and amenities such as flat-screen TVs and DVD players, as well as turndown service with chocolates. Some rooms may have street noise or lack a view, but the hotel is centrally located near Times Square and offers a quiet, romantic atmosphere.

The Jane Hotel offers small, cabin-like rooms with shared bathrooms, reminiscent of a vintage ship, and a lively bar scene that attracts crowds. Its location in the West Village provides easy access to dining, nightlife, and subway transportation.

The Kimberly Hotel offers spacious suites, with comfortable beds, and balconies that provide nice views of the city. Its central location in Midtown Manhattan is near restaurants, and subway lines, making it easy to get around.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan with spacious rooms that are individually owned and decorated, each with a kitchenette. The hotel is centrally located near shopping, restaurants, and transportation.

The London NYC offers spacious, modern suites with comfortable beds and a large shower, as well as a lively bar open until 1 AM. Some suites on higher floors offer views of Central Park and the city skyline.

The Lucerne is a clean, reasonably priced hotel on the Upper West Side, with many restaurants and bars nearby, but some rooms on Amsterdam Avenue can be noisy. It's close to Central Park and the subway for convenient access to the rest of Manhattan.

The Manhattan Club is in a prime location in midtown Manhattan, close to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, and Times Square. Some rooms have views of Central Park and the hotel has a business center, gym, and lounge on the 26th floor.

The Mansfield Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, with a bar that has a pleasant atmosphere and sometimes features live jazz. The rooms can be small and noisy, with some guests mentioning street noise and loud air conditioning units.

Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, trendy hotel with small rooms, comfortable beds, and a rooftop terrace; its bar/restaurant, Inoteca, has a lively, neighborhood feel, and there are many bars and restaurants nearby. Some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic, and the hotel has undergone renovations.

The Maritime Hotel has a lively atmosphere with a popular bar and outdoor terrace, sometimes causing noise issues in rooms, especially on lower floors. The hotel also features a nightclub and multiple restaurants, including a Japanese restaurant in the basement.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side near museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. Reviews mention spacious rooms (some with kitchenettes), marble bathrooms, and modern amenities like remote-controlled shades and TVs in the bathroom mirrors.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious suites with full kitchens, comfortable amenities, and city views from higher floors, including penthouse options with large terraces. It's located on the Upper East Side, near restaurants, shops, and public transportation, but some reviews mention potential noise from street construction.

The Mave Hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, near subway stops and attractions like Madison Square Park; rooms are clean and modern, but some are small and noisy due to window AC units. Staff are generally friendly and helpful, and some reviewers mention having a bottle of champagne upon arrival.

The Mercer is a trendy, centrally located hotel in SoHo with spacious, quiet rooms featuring amenities like large bathtubs, iPod docks, and access to a DVD/CD library. The hotel also has a comfortable lobby lounge and provides excellent room service.

The Michelangelo Hotel offers comfortable and spacious rooms with luxurious beds, large soaking tubs, and a quiet atmosphere, and it is centrally located near Broadway and other attractions. Some suites have sitting areas, multiple bathrooms, walk-in closets and vanity areas, and options for inner rooms for a quieter stay.

The Milburn Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchenettes in a quiet, residential Upper West Side location, near Central Park and subway lines. Some rooms feature king-sized beds, jacuzzis, balconies, and multiple TVs, with access to a DVD library.

The Muse Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and many reviewers note that its beds are very comfortable; however, some reviewers mention street noise and construction that may disrupt sleep. Some rooms have double-glazed windows to reduce noise.

Rooms on higher floors at the New York Helmsley have nice views, and the location is close to Grand Central, Times Square, and other attractions for evenings out. Some reviewers noted the comfortable beds and good security.

The New Yorker Hotel offers rooms with views of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building, and is close to the subway, Times Square, and Madison Square Garden. The hotel includes an Art Deco-style restaurant and bar that are open late.

The Pierre is a luxurious, old-world style hotel known for its excellent service, ideally located on Fifth Avenue across from Central Park; after renovations, rooms feature elegant and modern decor with high-quality furniture and marble bathrooms. Some rooms offer park views, and amenities include elevator operators, a lobby lounge, and the Caprice restaurant.

The Plaza Hotel offers luxurious rooms with comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms, and high-tech amenities, with some suites including butler service and private patios. The hotel's location is convenient to Central Park, shopping, and Broadway, with a house car available for transport.

The Pod Hotel offers small but clean and well-designed rooms with amenities like iPod docks and flat-screen TVs and a rooftop garden. It is located in Midtown East, close to subway stations, bars, and restaurants, but some rooms can be noisy.

The Premier is a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, with modern, clean rooms, and spacious bathrooms. It offers complimentary breakfast and evening drinks, and is located close to Times Square and the theater district.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park offers luxurious rooms with comfortable beds, high-quality sheets, DVD players, and marble bathrooms, with park view rooms providing spectacular views of Central Park. The hotel features a lobby bar and may offer club-level access, along with services like shoe shining and newspaper delivery.
The Roosevelt Hotel features a lobby bar that is busy and lively. The hotel also has a rooftop bar with panoramic city views.

The Sherry-Netherland is a small, luxurious hotel with individually owned and decorated rooms/suites, some offering Central Park views, binoculars, and telescopes. It provides a quiet and elegant respite with excellent service, fresh flowers, chocolates, and proximity to Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, and other attractions.
The Shoreham Hotel offers rooms with comfortable beds, massage chairs, and Aveda amenities. Some suites have balconies and multiple plasma TVs.

The St. Regis New York is a luxurious hotel with spacious, quiet guest rooms, marble bathrooms, and butler service; some suites have fireplaces, kitchenettes, and Central Park views. The hotel is centrally located near Fifth Avenue shopping and Central Park.

The Standard Hotel in NYC offers great views of the city, including the Hudson River, Empire State Building, and Statue of Liberty, from floor-to-ceiling windows, and also features a cool bar and restaurant scene. The 18th-floor lounge bar is a popular spot that turns into a nightclub after 9 pm, although hotel guests may not be able to enter due to crowds.
The Surrey is located on the Upper East Side, a few minutes walk to Central Park and the subway. The inside of the hotel is elegantly furnished and decorated.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, near a subway stop and grocery store, and offers apartments with well-equipped kitchens, terraces, and African art decor. The neighborhood has historical value, with the Jumel Mansion nearby, but some guests found the location far from downtown and potentially unsafe at night.

The Time Hotel, located near Times Square and Broadway, offers modern, though small, rooms and a hip bar/lounge that can be noisy on weekends, with some rooms featuring Bose stereo systems and trendy decor. Some rooms are near the bar and can be noisy, and the hotel sometimes hosts parties.
The Waldorf Astoria is a historic, art-deco style hotel with luxurious lobbies and bars. It has hosted various events, has welcomed queens, kings and presidents, and offers live music.

The Westin Times Square offers upscale amenities and clean, quiet rooms on upper floors with city views. It's located near theaters and Shula's restaurant, although some found the neighborhood sketchy.

The Thirty Thirty Hotel has a restaurant/bar attached and is near nightlife bars. The hotel is located on a quiet street a short walk away from Grand Central Station, Times Square, and the Empire State Building.

The Thompson LES is a trendy, modern hotel in the Lower East Side with a chic bar and rooms offering skyline views. However, some guests have noted noise issues from the bar or thin walls, so light sleepers may want to consider other options.

The Travel Inn is conveniently located near Times Square, but some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic or proximity to the pool area. Some reviewers mentioned thin walls, noisy air-con units, and train lines running underneath the hotel, which could impact sleep quality.

The Tribeca Grand is known for its trendy, energetic bar and lounge, which can be loud on weekend nights, sometimes until the early hours of the morning. Some rooms have noise-canceling systems to mitigate the sound, and the hotel is a popular spot for nightlife, especially during events like the Tribeca Film Festival.

The Trump International Hotel & Tower offers spacious suites with floor-to-ceiling windows that provide spectacular views of Central Park and Columbus Circle, and features a high level of service for a luxurious stay. Some suites include kitchens, jacuzzi tubs, and high-end amenities, offering a comfortable and well-appointed experience.

The Tudor Hotel offers a central location near Grand Central Station, with some rooms featuring terraces and jacuzzi tubs. It's also near Tudor City, which has quiet parks with fireflies and views of the East River and the UN.

The Vincci Avalon offers spacious rooms, some with Empire State Building views, and comfortable beds, but some guests have noted noise issues from air conditioning or street traffic. There is a bar, but it has limited hours, and reviews mention spacious rooms and large bathrooms.

The W The Court features a trendy bar scene that gets lively later in the evenings, though some guests experienced noise issues from the street or neighboring rooms. Some reviewers mention being upgraded to suites with B&O stereo systems and wet bars suitable for parties.

The W Tuscany is a trendy hotel with spacious rooms for NYC standards, located in the Murray Hill area near Grand Central Station. Some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building, and the hotel shares amenities with the W Court next door.
The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with a lively bar scene, often hosting a younger crowd. Some rooms offer great views of Times Square and the Hudson River.
The W Union Square offers stylish rooms, a lively bar scene, and a basement nightclub called Underbar. Some rooms have great views of Union Square and the surrounding city.

The Waldorf Towers offers large suites with great views, luxurious marble bathrooms, and a private entrance, with breakfast included. The hotel is known for its classic, old-world charm and convenient central location in Midtown Manhattan.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet hotel located in the Financial District, near subway stations, with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a complimentary continental breakfast. It's quieter than midtown, making it good for relaxation, but some found the staff to be unfriendly.

The Warwick Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park, with some rooms offering city views, balconies, or terraces. Some reviewers note issues with noise and dated decor, while others praise the spacious rooms and comfortable beds.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is in a great location, close to Times Square and Broadway theaters, though some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic. Rooms are small, but clean, with comfortable beds.
The Washington Square Hotel is located in Greenwich Village, near bars, restaurants, and live music on Bleecker Street. Some rooms offer views of Washington Square Park and the Empire State Building.

The Wellington Hotel is located in a prime spot between Central Park and Times Square and close to a subway; some rooms have views of Times Square. However, some guests reported noise issues and old rooms, while others appreciated the value for money and central location.

The hotel is in the heart of midtown Manhattan, on the same block as Carnegie Hall, and close to Central Park and the Theater District. Some rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with city views, and there is an Owners Lounge with an adjacent outside terrace.

The hotel is in a great location near Penn Station and Times Square, though some rooms can be noisy due to garbage trucks and street construction; earplugs and white noise machines are provided. Some rooms have disco music and Halloween parties until 4 am.

The Wolcott Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building and Times Square, with spacious rooms and a historic, old-world ambiance. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building, and some have multiple beds for groups.

Woogo Central Park Apartments is located on the Upper West Side of New York City, close to Central Park and subway lines, offering apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes. Reviews mention noise from garbage trucks, thin walls, and potential for roach infestations, with some guests finding the sofa beds uncomfortable.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel - Times Square South features a rooftop bar on the 10th floor with great views and a brand new, clean building, located within walking distance of Times Square and Penn Station. Some reviewers noted noise issues depending on room location and slow elevators during busy times.
